Metadata.CommitMsg: feat: add Kyverno as plain manifests (CRDs + app split) for ArgoCD git-source deploy
Metadata.Author: eepeychev <eepeychev@yettel.bg>

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'argo-server' of Deployment 'argo-server' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default security context configured
Misconfigurations.Description: Security context controls the allocation of security parameters for the pod/container/volume, ensuring the appropriate level of protection. Relying on default security context may expose vulnerabilities to potential attacks that rely on privileged access.
Misconfigurations.Message: container argo-server in argo namespace is using the default security context
Misconfigurations.Resolution: To enhance security, it is strongly recommended not to rely on the default security context. Instead, it is advisable to explicitly define the required security parameters (such as runAsNonRoot, capabilities, readOnlyRootFilesystem, etc.) within the security context.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default security context configured
Misconfigurations.Description: Security context controls the allocation of security parameters for the pod/container/volume, ensuring the appropriate level of protection. Relying on default security context may expose vulnerabilities to potential attacks that rely on privileged access.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment argo-server in argo namespace is using the default security context, which allows root privileges
Misconfigurations.Resolution: To enhance security, it is strongly recommended not to rely on the default security context. Instead, it is advisable to explicitly define the required security parameters (such as runAsNonRoot, capabilities, readOnlyRootFilesystem, etc.) within the security context.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the host’s loopback adapter.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'harbor-ca-installer' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'ca-installer' of DaemonSet 'harbor-ca-installer' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged
Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'ca-installer' of DaemonSet 'harbor-ca-installer' should set 'securityContext.privileged' to false
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.privileged' to 'false'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default security context configured
Misconfigurations.Description: Security context controls the allocation of security parameters for the pod/container/volume, ensuring the appropriate level of protection. Relying on default security context may expose vulnerabilities to potential attacks that rely on privileged access.
Misconfigurations.Message: daemonset harbor-ca-installer in kube-system namespace is using the default security context, which allows root privileges
Misconfigurations.Resolution: To enhance security, it is strongly recommended not to rely on the default security context. Instead, it is advisable to explicitly define the required security parameters (such as runAsNonRoot, capabilities, readOnlyRootFilesystem, etc.) within the security context.

Misconfigurations.Title: Kubernetes resource with disallowed volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPath present many security risks and as a security practice it is better to avoid critical host paths mounts.
Misconfigurations.Message: daemonset harbor-ca-installer in kube-system namespace shouldn't have volumes set to {"/"}
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not Set 'spec.volumes[*].hostPath.path' to any of the disallowed volumes.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the cluster resources, and therefore also root on all nodes where workloads can run and has access to all pods, secrets, and data.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:migrate-resources' shouldn't manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the cluster resources, and therefore also root on all nodes where workloads can run and has access to all pods, secrets, and data.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:migrate-resources' shouldn't manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes networking
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to control which pods get service traffic directed to them allows for interception attacks. Controlling network policy allows for bypassing lateral movement restrictions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:background-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["services", "endpoints", "endpointslices", "networkpolicies", "ingresses"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Networking resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage webhookconfigurations
Misconfigurations.Description: Webhooks can silently intercept or actively mutate/block resources as they are being created or updated. This includes secrets and pod specs.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:admission-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["mutatingwebhookconfigurations", "validatingwebhookconfigurations"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove webhook configuration resources/verbs, acceptable values for verbs ['get', 'list', 'watch']

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage webhookconfigurations
Misconfigurations.Description: Webhooks can silently intercept or actively mutate/block resources as they are being created or updated. This includes secrets and pod specs.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:cleanup-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["mutatingwebhookconfigurations", "validatingwebhookconfigurations"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove webhook configuration resources/verbs, acceptable values for verbs ['get', 'list', 'watch']

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'check-secret' of Job 'generate-cosign-key' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Lines.Content: if kubectl get secret cosign-key -n tekton-builds 2>/dev/null; then
Lines.Highlighted: if kubectl get secret cosign-key -n tekton-builds 2>/dev/null; then

Lines.Content: echo "Cosign key secret already exists, using existing"
Lines.Highlighted: echo "Cosign key secret already exists, using existing"

Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile
